tuv.seg: Social welfare payments and the student grant
Íocaíochtaí leasa shóisialaigh agus an deontas mac léinn
If you are returning to education and have been getting a social welfare payment you may qualify for the Back to Education Allowance or the student grant depending on your circumstances

Más ag filleadh ar oideachas atá tú agus má bhí íocaíocht leasa shóisialaigh á fáil agat, d’fhéadfá cáiliú don Liúntas um Fhilleadh ar Oideachas nó don scéim um dheontais do mhic léinn, ag brath ar do chuid cúinsí
You cannot get the Back to Education Allowance (BTEA) and a full student grant at the same time
Ní féidir (i mórchuid na gcásanna) Liúntas um Fhilleadh ar Oideachas agus deontas iomlán mac léinn a fháil ag an tráth céanna

If you are getting One-Parent Family Payment (OFP), Jobseeker's Transitional payment, Disability Allowance, Invalidity Pension or Illness Benefit, you will need to assess whether it is more beneficial for you to transfer to the BTEA when you go back to education or to remain on your current payment and apply for a student grant

Má tá Íocaíocht Teaghlach Aontuismitheora, Liúntas Míchumais, Pinsean Easláinte nó Sochar Breoiteachta á fháil agat, beidh ort a mheas an mbainfeá níos mó tairbhe as aistriú chuig an BTEA nuair a fhilleann tú ar oideachas nó chun fanacht agus d’íocaíocht reatha a fháil agus iarratas a dhéanamh ar dheontas mac léinn

Since 2015, if you are a new BTEA applicant and you were getting a jobseeker’s payment, Farm Assist, a One-Parent Family Payment or a Jobseeker's Transitional payment, you must re-establish your entitlement to a primary payment to continue to be entitled to BTEA for the second or subsequent years of study
Má Sochar Cuardaitheora Poist nó Liúntas Cuardaitheora Poist á fháil agat, ní mór duit aistriú chuig an BTEA más mian leat íocaíocht leasa shóisialaigh a choimeád nuair a fhilleann tú ar an oideachas
This document outlines your options
Tugtar sa cháipéis seo breac-chuntas ar do chuid roghanna
Back to Education Allowance
Liúntas um Fhilleadh ar Oideachas

The Back to Education Allowance (BTEA) allows people getting certain social welfare payments to get a social welfare payment while participating in approved full-time courses in further and higher education

Ligeann an Liúntas um Fhilleadh ar Oideachas (BTEA) do dhaoine ag a bhfuil íocaíochtaí leasa shóisialaigh íocaíocht leasa shóisialaigh a fháil fad a bhíonn páirt á glacadh acu i gcúrsaí lánaimseartha ceadaithe san ardoideachas agus sa bhreisoideachas
People taking part in the BTEA scheme are paid a weekly allowance equivalent to the social welfare payment they were getting before starting their course
Íoctar le daoine a ghlacann páirt i scéim an BTEA liúntas seachtainiúil den mhéid céanna de ráta an LFO agus d’íocaíocht cosanta sóisialta roimhe seo

Students doing full-time higher education undergraduate/postgraduate courses and full-time Post Leaving Certificate Courses (PLCs) may get financial support through the means-tested Student Grant Scheme. Grant rates for qualifying students vary according to a number of factors, including household income, family size and whether the student's college is close to their permanent residence

Is féidir le mic léinn a dhéanann cúrsaí lánaimseartha fochéime/iarchéime ardoideachais agus Cúrsaí lánaimseartha Iar-Ardteistiméireachta (PLCanna) tacaíocht airgeadais a fháil tríd an Scéim um Dheontais do Mhic Léinn a ndéantar tástáil mhaoine ina leith
From 2012 onwards, new postgraduate students do not qualify for a full student grant but they may qualify for a partial grant (see below) if they pass particular means tests

Tagann athrú ar rátaí deontais do mhic léinn a cháilítear de réir líon tosca, lena n-áirítear ioncam teaghlaigh, méid an teaghlaigh agus cibé acu an bhfuil coláiste an mhic léinn gar dá n-áit bhunachónaithe nó a mhalairt
The maintenance grant is a contribution towards the student’s living costs
Tá dhá chomhábhar sa scéim – deontas cothabhála agus deontas táillí

The fee grant can cover any of the following 3 elements: tuition fees, students contribution and cost of essential field trips. The postgraduate contribution may be payable to a postgraduate who passes a special means test

Ranníocaíocht i dtreo chostais mhaireachtála an mhic léinn is ea an deontas cothabhála, agus is féidir leis an deontas táillí íoc as aon cheann de na 3 ghné a leanas: táillí teagaisc, ranníocaíocht na mac léinn agus as costas turas ríthábhachtach allamuigh
In general if you qualify for a maintenance grant you will also qualify for whatever elements of a fee grant apply to your situation
Go ginearálta, má cháilítear thú don deontas cothabhála, cáileofar thú do pé gnéithe de dheontas táillí a bhaineann le do chás
Read more in our document on the Student Grant Scheme
An deontas cothabhála agus an BTEA
You cannot get a maintenance grant and a BTEA or a VTOS allowance together

Eisceachtaí: Má bhí an Liúntas um Fhilleadh ar Oideachas agus an deontas cothabhála mac léinn á bhfáil agat ag tús bhliain acadúil 2010, leanfaidh tú le bheith i dteideal an dá íocaíocht a fháil d’fhad iomlán do chúrsa reatha

If you have completed a course and now wish to progress to a course at a higher level, you can continue to retain your BTEA payment (generally up to and including level 8 on the National Framework of Qualifications)

Má chríochnaigh tú cúrsa agus más mian leat anois leanúint ar aghaidh agus cúrsa ar ardleibhéal a dhéanamh, is féidir leat leanúint agus d’íocaíocht BTEA a choimeád (a fhad le leibhéal 8 ar an gCreat Náisiúnta Cáilíochtaí agus an leibhéal sin san áireamh)
However, you will no longer be entitled to the maintenance component of the student grant
Ní bheidh tú i dteideal an comhábhar cothabhála den deontas mac léinn a fháil a thuilleadh, áfach

You can apply under the grant scheme to have the student contribution and any tuition fees/field trip costs paid on your behalf under the fee component of the student grant (if you qualify) and for a postgraduate fee contribution (if relevant)

Is féidir leat iarratas a dhéanamh faoin scéim deontais go n-íocfar as ranníocaíocht an mhic linn agus as aon táillí teagaisc/chostais turas allamuigh ar do shon faoin gcomhábhar táillí den deontas mac léinn (má cháilítear thú)

If you are getting the BTEA you do not qualify for the maintenance component of the student grant but you can apply for a fee grant to cover the student contribution and any course tuition fees not already covered by the Free Fees Scheme

Má tá an BTEA á fháil agat, ní cháilítear thú do chomhábhar cothabhála an deontais mhac léinn, ach is féidir leat iarratas a dhéanamh ar dheontas táillí chun íoc as ranníocaíocht an mhic léinn agus as aon táillí teagaisc den chúrsa nach gcuimsítear cheana féin faoin Scéim um Tháillí Saor in Aisce
Essential field trip costs may also be covered under a fee grant
D’fhéadfaí costais turas ríthábhachtach allamuigh a chuimsiú faoi dheontas táillí
Please note, however, that people getting BTEA may not qualify for payment of a fee grant – unless they meet the terms and conditions of the student grant scheme

Tabhair faoi deara, le do thoil, go dtarlódh nach bhfaigheadh daoine ag a bhfuil an BTEA á fháil le haghaidh íocaíocht deontas táillí – mura gcomhlíonann siad téarmaí agus coinníollacha na scéime deontas mac léinn
If you are getting the BTEA and wish to apply for these charges to be covered by a fee grant you should apply for a grant as soon as possible

Má tá an BTEA á fháil agat agus más mian leat iarratas a dhéanamh go gcuimseofar na táillí seo faoi dheontas táillí, ba cheart duit foirm iarratais ar dheontas a chomhlánú a luaithe agus is féidir agus í a sheoladh chuig d’údarás áitiúil nó chuig do Choiste Gairmoideachais áitiúil
If you are doing a Post-Leaving Certificate (PLC) course and getting the BTEA or a VTOS allowance you are exempt from the student participant charge (€200)
Má tá cúrsa Iar-Ardteistiméireachta (PLC) á dhéanamh agat, agus má tá an BTEA nó Liúntas VTOS á fháil agat, tá tú díolmhaithe ón muirear nua rannpháirtithe mac léinn (€200)
You may have to pay a course charge for books, exam fees and other costs
B’fhéidir go mbeidh ort muirear cúrsa a íoc le haghaidh leabhar, táillí agus costais eile
Social welfare payments and the BTEA
Íocaíochtaí leasa shóisialaigh agus an BTEA

If you are getting a One-Parent Family Payment, Jobseeker's Transitional payment or a disability payment (Disability Allowance, Invalidity Pension or Illness Benefit ) you can choose to stay on your current social welfare payment and apply for a student grant or you can choose to transfer to the BTEA

Má tá Íocaíocht Teaghlach Aontuismitheora nó íocaíocht mhíchumais (Liúntas Míchumais, Pinsean Easláinte nó Sochar Breoiteachta) á fháil agat, is féidir leat a roghnú chun fanacht agus d’íocaíocht reatha leasa shóisialaigh a fháil agus iarratas a dhéanamh ar dheontas cothabhála mac léinn nó is féidir leat roghnú go n-aistreofar thú chuig an BTEA
You will need to assess whether it is more beneficial for you to transfer to the BTEA when you go back to education or to remain on your current payment and apply for a student grant
Beidh ort a mheas cibé acu is tairbhiúla duit – aistriú chuig an BTEA nuair a fhilleann tú ar oideachas nó fanacht agus d'íocaíocht reatha a fháil agus iarratas a dhéanamh ar dheontas mac léinn
Further information on these two options is set out below
Leagtar amach thíos tuilleadh faisnéise ar an dá rogha seo
If you are getting Jobseeker’s Benefit or Jobseeker’s Allowance, you will no longer meet the conditions of your payment if you go back to education (since you must be available for and seeking work)

Má tá Sochar Cuardaitheora Poist nó Liúntas Cuardaitheora Poist á fháil agat, ní chomhlíonfaidh tú a thuilleadh coinníollacha d’íocaíochta má fhilleann tú ar oideachas (ós rud é nach mór fáil bheith ort le haghaidh oibre agus go mbíonn tú ag cuardach oibre)
This means that you must transfer to the BTEA if you wish to keep a social welfare payment when you go back to education – see ‘People getting Jobseeker’s Allowance or Benefit’ below

Ciallaíonn seo nach mór duit aistriú chuig an BTEA más mian leat íocaíocht leasa shóisialaigh a choimeád nuair a fhilleann tú ar an oideachas – féach ‘Daoine a fhaigheann Liúntas nó Sochar Cuardaitheora Poist’
People getting One-Parent Family Payment, Jobseeker's Transitional payment, Disability Allowance, Invalidity Pension or Illness Benefit
Daoine a fhaigheann Íocaíocht Teaghlach Aontuismitheora, Liúntas Míchumais, Pinsean Easláinte nó Sochar Breoiteachta
Option 1: Transfer to BTEA
Rogha 1: Aistriú chuig an BTEA
If you transfer to BTEA, you will:
Má aistríonn tú chuig an BTEA:
• Receive a payment equivalent to your current payment
• Gheobhaidh tú íocaíocht ar chomhionann leis de d’íocaíocht reatha
• Not be eligible for maintenance under the student grant scheme
• Ní bheidh tú i dteideal cothabháil a fháil faoin scéim um dheontais do mhic léinn
• Be able to apply under the student grant scheme for a fee grant to cover the student contribution and course fees/field trip costs (where appropriate)
• Beidh tú in ann iarratas a dhéanamh faoin scéim um dheontais do mhic léinn ar dheontas táillí chun íoc as ranníocaíocht an mhic léinn agus as costais táillí cúrsa/turas allamuigh (sa chás cuí)
• Be able to start part-time work during the academic year without affecting your BTEA payment – provided the work does not affect your studies and college attendance
• Beidh tú in ann oibriú go páirtaimseartha gan tionchar a imirt ar d’íocaíocht BTEA
• In general, retain secondary benefits like Rent Supplement
• Go ginearálta, beidh tú in ann sochair thánaisteacha, ar nós Forlíonadh Cíosa a choimeád
Note: If you are in receipt of Rent Supplement and your income increases, you will be re-assessed for Rent Supplement
Nóta: Má tá Forlíonadh Cíosa nó Forlíonadh Ús Morgáiste á fháil agat agus má mhéadaítear d’ioncam, déanfar athmheasúnú ort do na sochair seo
If you have a medical card, you are entitled to keep it while you are receiving BTEA
Má tá cárta leighis agat, tá tú i dteideal é a choimeád fad atá an BTEA á fháil agat
Option 2: Continue to get your One-Parent Family Payment, Jobseeker's Transitional payment, Disability Allowance, Invalidity Pension or Illness Benefit
Rogha 2: Leanúint agus d’Íocaíocht Teaghlach Aontuismitheora, Liúntas Míchumais, Pinsean Easláinte nó Sochar Breoiteachta a fháil
If you continue to get your One-Parent Family Payment, Jobseeker's Transitional payment, Disability Allowance, Invalidity Pension or Illness Benefit, you will:
Má leanann tú agus d’Íocaíocht Teaghlach Aontuismitheora, Liúntas Míchumais, Pinsean Easláinte nó Sochar Breoiteachta a fháil:
• Keep your existing payment
• Coimeádfaidh tú d’íocaíocht reatha

• Be entitled to apply for both the maintenance and fee components of the student grant and a postgraduate fee contribution (if relevant). (Note that applicants on social welfare payments do not automatically qualify for a grant)

• Beidh tú i dteideal iarratas a dhéaanmh ar chomhábhair chothabhála agus tháillí den deontas mac léinn (Nóta: Ní cháilítear iarratasóirí ar íocaíochtaí leasa shóisialaigh go huathoibríoch le haghaidh deontais)

• In general, lose your Rent Supplement, because you are in full-time education • Note that if your course requires you to travel abroad for an Erasmus year, your primary payment will not continue to be paid while abroad
• Go ginearálta, caillfidh tú d’Fhorlíonadh Cíosa nó d’Forlíonadh Ús Morgáiste, de bharr go bhfuil tú ag plé le hoideachas lánaimseartha
If you have a medical card, you are entitled to retain it for a period of 3 years from the date of entry to full-time education, after which you will be re-assessed
Má tá cárta leighis agat, beidh tú i dteideal é a choimeád ar feadh tréimhse 3 bliana ó dháta iontrála an oideachais lánaimseartha, agus déanfar thú a athmheasúnú ina dhiaidh seo

If you are currently getting the One-Parent Family Payment, changes in your family circumstances while you are in full-time education might affect your eligibility for the payment (for example, if a child no longer lives with you or goes over the age limit)

Má tá an Íocaíocht Teaghlach Aontuismitheora á fáil agat faoi láthair, d’fhéadfadh athruithe ar do chúinsí teaghlaigh fad a bhíonn tú ag plé le hoideachas lánaimseartha tionchar a imirt ar do theidlíocht chun an íocaíocht a fháil (mar shampla, mura gcónaíonn leanbh leat a thuilleadh nó má sháraíonn siad an aoisteorainn)
You should factor any such changes into your planning for income support during your course
Má aistríonn tú chuig an BTEA, tá d'íocaíocht faoi ráthaíocht le haghaidh fhad do chúrsa
From 4 July 2013, if you had opted to stay on your OFP and go back to education but no longer qualify for OFP due to changes in the ages limits you may be admitted to BTEA ‘mid course’
Ba cheart duit aon athruithe den chineál sin a chur san áireamh agus pleanáil á déanamh agat ar thacaíocht ioncaim le linn do chúrsa
There is a special arrangement for people whose OFP claim ended on 2 July 2015
Daoine a fhaigheann Liúntas Cuardaitheora Poist nó Sochar Cuardaitheora Poist
If you are getting Jobseeker's Allowance (JA) or Jobseeker's Benefit (JB), you must transfer to BTEA to keep a social welfare payment (including secondary benefits) during full-time education

Má tá Liúntas Cuardaitheora Poist (JA) nó Sochar Cuardaitheora Poist (JB) á fháil agat, ní mór duit aistriú chuig an BTEA chun íocaíocht leasa shóisialaigh a choimeád (lena n-áirítear sochair thánaisteacha) le linn oideachas lánaimseartha
The reason for this is that you cannot be genuinely available for and seeking employment when participating in full-time education
Is í an chúis atá leis seo, nach féidir fáil bheith ort agus nach féidir leat fostaíocht bheith á cuardach agat, i ndáiríre, agus páirt á glacadh agat in oideachas lánaimseartha

Since the 2016/2017 academic year, people getting BTEA who take up work during the academic year will be assessed under the rules (including means assessment) that apply to their primary payment - the payment they qualified for BTEA from

Má cháilítear thú don Liúntas um Fhilleadh ar Oideachas, is féidir leat do theidlíocht i leith aon sochar tánaisteach atá agat cheana féin a choiméad, mar shampla, Liúntas Breosla, Forlíonadh Cíosa agus Forlíonadh Ús Morgáiste
This only applies new applicants or people who return to BTEA after a break. Previously part-time work during the academic year did not affect the rate of BTEA paid
Ní imreoidh obair ar luach saothair tionchar ar d'íocaíocht BTEA ach d’fhéadfadh aon ioncam breise tionchar a imirt ar do shochair thánaisteacha

Once you transfer from JA or JB to the BTEA, you are not eligible for the maintenance component of the student grant but you can apply for a fee grant – covering the student contribution, field trip costs and fees (if payable) under the student grant scheme. You should do this as soon as possible. People coming from jobseeker’s payments or Farm Assist are paid BTEA for the academic year only and not for the summer months between academic years

A luaithe a aistríonn tú ón LCP nó ón SCP chuig an BTEA, ní bheidh tú i dteideal an comhábhar cothabhála den deontas mac léinn a fháil ach is féidir leat iarratas a dhéanamh ar dheontas táillí – a íocfaidh as ranníocaíocht an mhic léinn, as costais tuaras allamuuigh agus as táillí (más iníoctha dóibh) trí leas a bhaint as an bhfoirm le haghaidh an deontais mhac léinn
Signing on for credits only and the student grant
Ba cheart duit é seo a dhéanamh a luaithe is féidir
The following case studies show the options available to people on different types of social welfare payments and the advantages and disadvantages of each option

Leagadh amach na cás-staidéir seo a leanas chun léiriú níos fearr a thabhairt ar na roghanna atá ar fáil do dhaoine atá ar chineálacha éagsúla íocaíochtaí leasa shóisialaigh agus ar na buntáistí agus na míbhuntáistí a bhaineann le gach rogha díobh
A: I’m getting Jobseeker’s Allowance and starting a full-time course in further or higher education:
A: Tá Liúntas Cuardaitheora Poist á fháil agam agus táim ag tosú ar chúrsa lánaimseartha breisoideachais nó ardoideachais:
You cannot get Jobseeker’s Allowance (JA) and attend full-time education
Ní féidir leat Liúntas Cuardaitheora Poist a fháil agus tú ag freastal go lánaimseartha ar oideachas
If you are getting Jobseeker’s Allowance you should apply for the Back to Education Allowance (BTEA)
Má tá Liúntas Cuardaitheora Poist á fháil agat ba cheart duit cur isteach ar an Liúntas um Fhilleadh ar an Oideachas (LFO)

If you qualify, your rate of payment on BTEA will be the same as the payment you were getting (if you were getting an age-related reduced rate of JA you get a standard BTEA rate of €160) and you will keep any secondary benefits you are getting
Má tá tú incháilithe gheobhaidh tú LFO ar an ráta céanna agus uasráta an Liúntais Chuardaitheora Poist agus féadfaidh tú aon sochair thánaisteacha a bhíodh agat a choinneáil
You do not get the maintenance component of the student grant with BTEA, but you will be financially better off on BTEA than you would be on the maintenance grant alone

Má athraíonn tú ó ráta laghdaithe Liúntais Chuardaitheora Poist go ráta uasta an Liúntais sin d’fhéadfadh sé tionchar a bheith aige ar an bhForlíonadh Cíosa nó ar an bhForlíonadh Ús Morgáiste atá á fháil agat

Since the 2016/2017 academic year, people getting BTEA who take up work during the academic year will be assessed under the rules (including means assessment) that apply to their primary payment - the payment they qualified for BTEA from
Ní bhfaighidh tú deontas cothaithe mar aon le LFO ach bheadh tú níos fearr as ó thaobh airgid de an LFO a fháil ná mar a bheifeá ag fáil an deontais chothaithe amháin
This only applies new applicants or people who return to BTEA after a break. Previously part-time work during the academic year did not affect the rate of BTEA paid
Ní chuirfidh ioncam a thuilleann tú de thoradh fostaíochta le pá isteach ar do LFO ná ar do sochair thánaisteacha ach amháin i gcás Forlíonadh Cíosa nó Forlíonadh Ús Morgáiste

You must still apply to be assessed for the fee component of the student grant, covering the student contribution and any tuition fees or essential field trip costs and for a postgraduate fee contribution (if relevant)
Beidh ort iarratas a dhéanamh fós chuig d’údarás áitiúil nó do Choiste Gairmoideachais le go ndéanfar measúnú ort i gcomhair na táille seirbhísí mac léinn agus na dtáillí teagaisc
You should submit your application immediately
Ba chóir duit d’iarratas a chur isteach láithreach
B: I’m getting a One-Parent Family Payment and starting a full-time course in further or higher education:
B: Tá Íocaíocht do Theaghlach Aon-Tuismitheora á fháil agam agus táim ag tosú ar chúrsa lánaimseartha breisoideachais nó ardoideachais:
If you are getting a One-Parent Family Payment you have two options and you need to work out which will give you the higher income
Tá dhá rogha agat má tá Íocaíocht do Theaghlach Aon-Tuismitheora á fháil agat agus caithfidh tú a dhéanamh amach cé acu a thabharfaidh an t-ioncam is airde duit
You can stay on your One-Parent Family Payment and apply for a student grant
Feadfaidh tú an Íocaíocht do Theaghlach Aon-Tuismitheora atá á fháil agat a choinneáil agus cur isteach ar dheontas cothaithe
If you choose this option you will continue to get your One-Parent Family Payment at your current rate and may qualify for the student grant
Má thograíonn tú é sin a dhéanamh leanfaidh tú ort ag fáil na hÍocaíochta do Theaghlach Aon-Tuismitheora ar do ráta reatha agus d’fheadfá a bheith incháilithe chun deontas cothaithe a fháil
However, you will lose any secondary benefits you are getting such as Rent Supplement or Mortgage Interest Supplement
Caillfidh tú aon sochar tánaisteach atá á fháil agat, áfach, mar Fhorlíonadh Cíosa nó Fhorlíonadh Ús Morgáiste
You can transfer from your One-Parent Family Payment to the BTEA
D’fhéadfá aistriú ón Íocaíocht do Theaghlach Aon-Tuismitheora go dtí an LFO
If you choose this option and qualify for BTEA, you will not get the maintenance component of the student grant
Má thograíonn tú é sin a dhéanamh agus má tá tú incháilithe chun an LFO a fháil ní bhfaighidh tú aon deontas cothaithe
Your rate of payment on BTEA will be the same as the rate of One-Parent Family Payment you were getting and you can keep any secondary benefits you may be getting
Gheobhaidh tú an LFO ar an ráta céanna agus uasráta na hÍocaíochta do Theaghlach Aon-Tuismitheora agus féadfaidh tú aon sochar tánaisteach atá á fháil agat a choinneáil

Since the 2016/2017 academic year, people getting BTEA who take up work during the academic year will be assessed under the rules (including means assessment) that apply to their primary payment - the payment they qualified for BTEA from
Má athraíonn tú ó ráta laghdaithe Íocaíochta Teaghlaigh Aontuismitheora go dtí an ráta uasta d’fhéadfadh sé sin tionchar a bheith aige ar Fhorlíonadh Cíosa nó ar Fhorlíonadh Ús Morgáiste
This only applies new applicants or people who return to BTEA after a break. Previously part-time work during the academic year did not affect the rate of BTEA paid
Ní chuirfidh ioncam a thuilleann tú de thoradh fostaíochta le pá isteach ar do LFO ná ar do sochair thánaisteacha ach amháin i gcás Forlíonadh Cíosa nó Forlíonadh Ús Morgáiste

C: I’m getting a Disability Allowance and starting a full-time course in further or higher education:
C: Tá Liúntas Míchumais á fháil agam agus táim ag tosú ar chúrsa lánaimseartha breisoideachais nó ardoideachais:
If you are getting a Disability Allowance (DA) you have 2 options and you need to work out which will give you the higher income
Tá dhá rogha agat má tá Liúntas Míchumais á fháil agat agus caithfidh tú a dhéanamh amach cé acu a chuirfidh an t-ioncam is airde ar fáil duit
You can stay on your Disability Allowance and apply for a student grant
Feadfaidh tú an Liúntas Míchumais atá á fháil agat a choinneáil agus cur isteach ar dheontas cothaithe
If you choose this option you will continue to get your Disability Allowance at your current rate
Má thograíonn tú é sin a dhéanamh leanfaidh tú ort ag fáil an Liúntais Mhíchumais ar an ráta reatha
However, you will lose secondary benefits such as Rent Supplement or Mortgage Interest Supplement
Caillfidh tú aon sochar tánaisteach atá á fháil agat, áfach, mar Fhorlíonadh Cíosa nó Fhorlíonadh Ús Morgáiste

If you are living at home, your parents’ income could affect the amount of grant you get. It may mean you get a reduced amount of maintenance grant, or just the fee component of the student grant, or neither
D’fhéadfadh tionchar a bheith ag ioncam do thuismitheoirí ar méid an deontais chothaithe a gheobhaidh tú má tá tú i do chónaí sa bhaile
If your course of study has an Erasmus component (study at a college abroad), your DA payment will not be paid while you are absent from the State
D’fhéadfá deontas cothaithe laghdaithe a fháil dá bharr, nó gan ach an Táille Sheirbhísí Mac Léinn a fháil, nó d’fhéadfá gan ceachtar acu a fháil ar chor ar bith
You can transfer from your Disability Allowance to the Back to Education Allowance (BTEA)
Féadfaidh tú aistriú ón Liúntas Míchumais atá á fháil agat go dtí an Liúntas um Fhilleadh ar an Oideachas (LFO)
If you choose this option and qualify for BTEA you will not get the maintenance component of the student grant
Má thograíonn tú é sin a dhéanamh agus má tá tú incháilithe chun an LFO a fháil ní bhfaighidh tú deontas cothaithe
Your rate of payment on BTEA will be the same as the rate of Disability Allowance you were getting and you can keep any secondary benefits you may be getting
Gheobhaidh tú an LFO ar an ráta céanna agus uasráta an Liúntais Mhíchumais agus féadfaidh tú aon sochar tánaisteach atá á fháil agat a bheith agat i gcónaí
Your BTEA will continue to be paid if you are required to study abroad for an Erasmus year
Má athraíonn tú ó ráta laghdaithe go ráta uasta an Liúntais Mhíchumais d’fhéadfadh sé sin tionchar a bheith aige ar an bhForlíonadh Cíosa nó ar an bhForlíonadh Ús Morgáiste

Since the 2016/2017 academic year, people getting BTEA who take up work during the academic year will be assessed under the rules (including means assessment) that apply to their primary payment - the payment they qualified for BTEA from
